revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-28 10:24:09.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Ignore device already in the process of unplug errors

At present QEMU will raise an error to libvirt when a device_del request
is made for a device that has already partially detached through a
previous request. This is outlined in more detail in the following
downstream Red Hat QEMU bug report:

Get libvirtError "Device XX is already in the process of unplug" [..]
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1878659

Within Nova we can actually ignore this error and allow our existing
retry logic to attempt again after a short wait, hopefully allowing the
original request to complete removing the device from the domain.

This change does this and should result in one of the following
device_del requests raising a VIR_ERR_DEVICE_MISSING error from libvirt.
_try_detach_device should then translate that libvirt error into a
DeviceNotFound exception which is itself then ignored by all
detach_device_with_retry callers and taken to mean that the device has
detached successfully.

NOTE(lyarwood): For stable/victoria the conditional has been inlined
within some VIR_ERR_DEVICE_MISSING compat code removed in stable/wallaby
by I181b3bf433b0fcef92ef4d430e9858506f24153c. Additionally the
supports_device_missing_error_code kwarg is added to the
detach_device_with_retry call within the test to ensure the exception is
checked.

Closes-Bug: #1923206
Change-Id: I0e068043d8267ab91535413d950a3e154c2234f7
(cherry picked from commit 0a7d3794c6dc39976b4cbfe12b1688230ac895a8)
(cherry picked from commit 972a86d61f6b6f0f3d1af549b081854e6ff016bc)

commit_message:
libvirt: Ignore device already in the process of unplug errors

At present QEMU will raise an error to libvirt when a device_del request
is made for a device that has already partially detached through a
previous request. This is outlined in more detail in the following
downstream Red Hat QEMU bug report:

Get libvirtError "Device XX is already in the process of unplug" [..]
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1878659

Within Nova we can actually ignore this error and allow our existing
retry logic to attempt again after a short wait, hopefully allowing the
original request to complete removing the device from the domain.

This change does this and should result in one of the following
device_del requests raising a VIR_ERR_DEVICE_MISSING error from libvirt.
_try_detach_device should then translate that libvirt error into a
DeviceNotFound exception which is itself then ignored by all
detach_device_with_retry callers and taken to mean that the device has
detached successfully.

NOTE(lyarwood): For stable/victoria the conditional has been inlined
within some VIR_ERR_DEVICE_MISSING compat code removed in stable/wallaby
by I181b3bf433b0fcef92ef4d430e9858506f24153c. Additionally the
supports_device_missing_error_code kwarg is added to the
detach_device_with_retry call within the test to ensure the exception is
checked.

Conflicts:
    nova/virt/libvirt/guest.py

Closes-Bug: #1923206
Change-Id: I0e068043d8267ab91535413d950a3e154c2234f7
(cherry picked from commit 0a7d3794c6dc39976b4cbfe12b1688230ac895a8)
(cherry picked from commit 972a86d61f6b6f0f3d1af549b081854e6ff016bc)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-19 11:44:28.000000000', 'message': 'cinder: Increase VOLUME_BACKING_FILE_SIZE

As reported in bug #1920136 the tempest-integrated-compute job has
started to see insufficient free virtual space errors being reported by
c-sch and c-vol when creating volumes. This change simply increases the
default size of the underlying LVM PV used to host these volumes within
the default LVM/iSCSI c-vol backend deployed by devstack.

Change-Id: I965d4a485215ac482403f1e83609452550dfd860
Closes-Bug: #1920136
(cherry picked from commit 362641b1b8b0596371f13db8448ab0f43bd53482)
'}]
commit_message:
cinder: Increase VOLUME_BACKING_FILE_SIZE

As reported in bug #1920136 the tempest-integrated-compute job has
started to see insufficient free virtual space errors being reported by
c-sch and c-vol when creating volumes. This change simply increases the
default size of the underlying LVM PV used to host these volumes within
the default LVM/iSCSI c-vol backend deployed by devstack.

Change-Id: I965d4a485215ac482403f1e83609452550dfd860
Closes-Bug: #1920136
(cherry picked from commit 362641b1b8b0596371f13db8448ab0f43bd53482)

subject: libvirt: Ignore device already in the process of unplug errors
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-28 10:26:30.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Ignore device already in the process of unplug errors

At present QEMU will raise an error to libvirt when a device_del request
is made for a device that has already partially detached through a
previous request. This is outlined in more detail in the following
downstream Red Hat QEMU bug report:

Get libvirtError "Device XX is already in the process of unplug" [..]
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1878659

Within Nova we can actually ignore this error and allow our existing
retry logic to attempt again after a short wait, hopefully allowing the
original request to complete removing the device from the domain.

This change does this and should result in one of the following
device_del requests raising a VIR_ERR_DEVICE_MISSING error from libvirt.
_try_detach_device should then translate that libvirt error into a
DeviceNotFound exception which is itself then ignored by all
detach_device_with_retry callers and taken to mean that the device has
detached successfully.

Closes-Bug: #1923206
Change-Id: I0e068043d8267ab91535413d950a3e154c2234f7
(cherry picked from commit 0a7d3794c6dc39976b4cbfe12b1688230ac895a8)
(cherry picked from commit 972a86d61f6b6f0f3d1af549b081854e6ff016bc)
(cherry picked from commit 4496dfe72020a9e658b04edcba90ddf7f578465f)
(cherry picked from commit 5acc9316310028ccb3603d1ff7f0870018f834cd)
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Ignore device already in the process of unplug errors

At present QEMU will raise an error to libvirt when a device_del request
is made for a device that has already partially detached through a
previous request. This is outlined in more detail in the following
downstream Red Hat QEMU bug report:

Get libvirtError "Device XX is already in the process of unplug" [..]
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1878659

Within Nova we can actually ignore this error and allow our existing
retry logic to attempt again after a short wait, hopefully allowing the
original request to complete removing the device from the domain.

This change does this and should result in one of the following
device_del requests raising a VIR_ERR_DEVICE_MISSING error from libvirt.
_try_detach_device should then translate that libvirt error into a
DeviceNotFound exception which is itself then ignored by all
detach_device_with_retry callers and taken to mean that the device has
detached successfully.

Closes-Bug: #1923206
Change-Id: I0e068043d8267ab91535413d950a3e154c2234f7
(cherry picked from commit 0a7d3794c6dc39976b4cbfe12b1688230ac895a8)
(cherry picked from commit 972a86d61f6b6f0f3d1af549b081854e6ff016bc)
(cherry picked from commit 4496dfe72020a9e658b04edcba90ddf7f578465f)
(cherry picked from commit 5acc9316310028ccb3603d1ff7f0870018f834cd)

commit_message:
libvirt: Ignore device already in the process of unplug errors

At present QEMU will raise an error to libvirt when a device_del request
is made for a device that has already partially detached through a
previous request. This is outlined in more detail in the following
downstream Red Hat QEMU bug report:

Get libvirtError "Device XX is already in the process of unplug" [..]
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1878659

Within Nova we can actually ignore this error and allow our existing
retry logic to attempt again after a short wait, hopefully allowing the
original request to complete removing the device from the domain.

This change does this and should result in one of the following
device_del requests raising a VIR_ERR_DEVICE_MISSING error from libvirt.
_try_detach_device should then translate that libvirt error into a
DeviceNotFound exception which is itself then ignored by all
detach_device_with_retry callers and taken to mean that the device has
detached successfully.

Closes-Bug: #1923206
Change-Id: I0e068043d8267ab91535413d950a3e154c2234f7
(cherry picked from commit 0a7d3794c6dc39976b4cbfe12b1688230ac895a8)
(cherry picked from commit 972a86d61f6b6f0f3d1af549b081854e6ff016bc)
(cherry picked from commit 4496dfe72020a9e658b04edcba90ddf7f578465f)

commit_message:
Changed minversion in tox to 3.18.0

The patch bumps min version of tox to 3.18.0 python in order to
replace tox's whitelist_externals by allowlist_externals option:
https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/blob/master/docs/changelog.rst#v3180-2020-07-23
The patch also sets ubuntu-focal nodeset for the docs job as newer
ubuntu (with newer tox available) is required.

Change-Id: I5b32e7f65710199601a6856dba86584390eb92b7

commit_message:
[DVR] Send allowed address pairs info to the L3 agents

When new dvr router is going to be created on the node, L3 agent
asks server for list of ports plugged to the subnets, to populate
arp entries for all fixed IPs from those ports.
There was missing info about allowed address pairs there, so those
IPs were not populated in the qrouter namespace.
Now it's added and L3 agent can add those arp entries to the qrouter
namespaces too.

Closes-Bug: #1928466
Change-Id: I5d6c72c271ff450d9e43b3e33a99dd59d727882d

commit_message:
Remove Monasca Grafana service

In the Xena cycle it was decided to remove the Monasca
Grafana fork due to lack of maintenance. This commit removes
the service and provides a limited workaround using the
Monasca Grafana datasource with vanilla Grafana.

Depends-On: I9db7ec2df050fa20317d84f6cea40d1f5fd42e60
Change-Id: I4917ece1951084f6665722ba9a91d47764d3709a

commit_message:
Disable usage collection in Kibana

This commit disables collection of usage data in Kibana by default.
User has still an option to enable it via GUI. Reference: [1]

[1] https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/kibana/7.x/telemetry-settings-kbn.html

Change-Id: Ic3a8bf05a73fb042ae42cbd26ccced60240d8e94

commit_message:
Install Monasca datasource plugin for Grafana

The Monasca Grafana image has been removed. This change provides
a path for Monasca users to switch to using the vanilla Grafana
image.

Depends-On: I8f5a9b220fc8afd6ef07cb5f2142df8c6ead9bc0
Change-Id: I9db7ec2df050fa20317d84f6cea40d1f5fd42e60

commit_message:
Set manila_backends to empty dict by default

This simplifies logic across the role and not verify if variable is
defined each time we're attempting to use it.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible/+/787341
Change-Id: I6db4ad6e6389b1ff63dc52a1e48c477a97905d17

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-17 08:47:26.000000000', 'message': "Ensure keepalived is upgraded

Ussuri & earlier only

After upgrading from Train to Ussuri, if the keepalived configuration is
unchanged, it is possible that the primary keepalived container will not
be upgraded. This happens because we do not import check-containers.yml
in upgrade.yml, meaning that the 'Restart keepalived container' handler
does not fire. This change fixes the issue.

Closes-Bug: #1928362

Change-Id: I56775f1c0a8849c10ad5181cde6b50b2694a0512
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure keepalived is upgraded

Ussuri & earlier only

After upgrading from Train to Ussuri, if the keepalived configuration is
unchanged, it is possible that the primary keepalived container will not
be upgraded. This happens because we do not import check-containers.yml
in upgrade.yml, meaning that the 'Restart keepalived container' handler
does not fire. This change fixes the issue.

Closes-Bug: #1928362

Change-Id: I56775f1c0a8849c10ad5181cde6b50b2694a0512

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-20 00:14:51.000000000', 'message': 'Fix with_entities usage in db queries

In order to retrieve shares with filters
pertaining to separate tables (shares, instances, metadata,
etc), we need to perform joined loads of those
respective database tables as necessary. After the
join, the query cannot select entities due to
Github issue #6253 - The following is an error when
the pattern is used:

sqlalchemy.exc.ArgumentError: Query has only expression-based entities - can't find property named "share_metadata".

sqlalchemy 1.4 has a performance improvement that
delays query processing [2] and disallows this
pattern of usage; we can use a query.count() instead.

In another instance, we can perform joins selectively
only if asked for.

[1] https://github.com/sqlalchemy/sqlalchemy/issues/625
[2] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/changelog/migration_14.html#many-core-and-orm-statement-objects-now-perform-much-of-their-construction-and-validation-in-the-compile-phase

Change-Id: I8aa196c171bbc224cec06f517ea22c4e91cbc06a
Closes-Bug: #1926399
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
'}, {'created': '2021-05-20 10:33:06.000000000', 'message': 'Fix with_entities usage in db queries

sqlalchemy.exc.ArgumentError: Query has only expression-based entities - can't find property named "share_metadata".

In another instance, we can perform joins selectively
only if asked for.

[1] https://github.com/sqlalchemy/sqlalchemy/issues/625
[2] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/changelog/migration_14.html#many-core-and-orm-statement-objects-now-perform-much-of-their-construction-and-validation-in-the-compile-phase

Change-Id: I8aa196c171bbc224cec06f517ea22c4e91cbc06a
Closes-Bug: #1926399
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix with_entities usage in db queries

In order to retrieve shares with filters
pertaining to separate tables (shares, instances, metadata,
etc), we need to perform joined loads of those
respective database tables as necessary. After the
join, the query cannot select entities due to
Github issue #6253 - The following is an error when
the pattern is used:

sqlalchemy.exc.ArgumentError: Query has only expression-based entities - can't find property named "share_metadata".

sqlalchemy 1.4 has a performance improvement that
delays query processing [2] and disallows this
pattern of usage; we can use a query.count() instead.

In another instance, we can perform joins selectively
only if asked for.

[1] https://github.com/sqlalchemy/sqlalchemy/issues/625
[2] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/changelog/migration_14.html#many-core-and-orm-statement-objects-now-perform-much-of-their-construction-and-validation-in-the-compile-phase

Change-Id: I8aa196c171bbc224cec06f517ea22c4e91cbc06a
Closes-Bug: #1926399
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix Python 2.7 compatibility for test_ansible.py

[1] broke Python 2.7 compatibility, which is still maintained by
the rest of the codebase (for CentOS 7 support).

[1] - https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/validations-libs/+/777100

Change-Id: Ia338ef0f1f83a6da4f9836deb7ecbce48634fdf8

commit_message:
Reqcheck job for upstream validations-common

Zuul job queries the requirements.txt and the relevant
spec file using the `rdopkg reqcheck` to find discrepancies
in the listed dependencies.

Just like the original `rdopkg-reqcheck` this job is non-voting.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I45043407b38bdcd0c0a38b30b65b5d5f70cae76d

commit_message:
Bump molecule to 3.3.1

This patch also adds molecule-podman driver as a requirement
because molecule >=3.2 stopped installing it by default.

Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add role-name lint check to warnings

role-name check is new one, which verifies role name regexp according to
the ansible guide [1]
based on the meta file, but does not have metadata tag on it.

[1] https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/devel/dev_guide/developing_collections.html#roles-directory

Change-Id: I2dc887a3932e40f634f3bcb0aec46faf314f1907

subject: setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores
messages: [{'account_id': 32326, 'date': '2021-05-04 02:08:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2021-05-04 02:26:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2021-05-20 21:53:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nLGTM'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2021-05-21 07:23:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Backport-Candidate-2 Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-04 02:08:49.000000000', 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I91c4e1829e33d9a3bb3f01629275e9a380e6d07a
"}]
commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I91c4e1829e33d9a3bb3f01629275e9a380e6d07a

subject: tempurl: Fix PUT upload to temp url on py3
messages:
[{'account_id': 31241, 'date': '2021-05-20 15:11:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-05-20 18:51:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-05-20 18:54:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Good fix, thanks! I'm a little surprised our func test at https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/2.25.1/test/functional/test_tempurl.py#L201 didn't catch it, but I suppose different proxy pipelines may prevent it from being a problem. Out of curiosity, what's your pipeline look like?

Hope you don't mind me pushing a new patchset; just including a test to make sure we don't regress."}, {'account_id': 31241, 'date': '2021-05-20 19:27:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Good fix, thanks! I'm a little surprised our func test at https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/2.25.1/test/functional/test_tempurl.py#L201 didn't catch it, but I suppose different proxy pipelines may prevent it from being a problem. Out of curiosity, what's your pipeline look like?

    [pipeline:main]
    pipeline = catch_errors healthcheck cache listing_formats tempurl formpost authtoken s3api s3token keystoneauth staticweb copy slo dlo keymaster encryption proxy-logging proxy-server

I don't know why that test doesn't trap it. I assume that the catch_errors middleware is not loaded? Or that the code takes another path, not reaching the .append().

In the ticket I did mention at least one other case of .items() that may cause issues, but is not related to the tempurl-PUT. There might be more.
 
> Hope you don't mind me pushing a new patchset; just including a test to make sure we don't regress.

Of course I don't mind 😊
Tests FTW"}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-05-20 22:23:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow+1

Interesting -- we usually recommend doubled-up proxy-logging, with one copy early in the pipeline (given yours, I'd probably put it between healthcheck and cache) so you can get the best picture you can of what the client sent, and the other late (just as you have it) to better see subrequests."}, {'account_id': 31241, 'date': '2021-05-21 07:32:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Interesting -- we usually recommend doubled-up proxy-logging, with one copy early in the pipeline (given yours, I'd probably put it between healthcheck and cache) so you can get the best picture you can of what the client sent, and the other late (just as you have it) to better see subrequests.

Hm.. I think this pipeline may have organically grown. Thanks for the suggestion!

Should I cherry-pick this to victoria and ussuri?"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-20 15:11:05.000000000', 'message': 'tempurl: Fix PUT upload to temp url

Without this change, the self._response_headers gets a dict_items() type
on PUT. But the rest of the code assumes that it is a list.

Bug manifestation:

    File "swift/common/middleware/catch_errors.py", line 120,
        in handle_request
      self._response_headers.append(('X-Trans-Id', trans_id))
  AttributeError: 'dict_items' object has no attribute 'append'

Closes-Bug: #1929083
Change-Id: I5c398b6008716b64c668737e4201ba3b6ab3320b
'}, {'created': '2021-05-20 18:51:23.000000000', 'message': 'tempurl: Fix PUT upload to temp url on py3

Without this change, the self._response_headers gets a dict_items() type
on PUT. But the rest of the code assumes that it is a list.

Bug manifestation:

    File "swift/common/middleware/catch_errors.py", line 120,
        in handle_request
      self._response_headers.append(('X-Trans-Id', trans_id))
  AttributeError: 'dict_items' object has no attribute 'append'

Closes-Bug: #1929083
Change-Id: I5c398b6008716b64c668737e4201ba3b6ab3320b
'}]
commit_message:
tempurl: Fix PUT upload to temp url on py3

Without this change, the self._response_headers gets a dict_items() type
on PUT. But the rest of the code assumes that it is a list.

Bug manifestation:

    File "swift/common/middleware/catch_errors.py", line 120,
        in handle_request
      self._response_headers.append(('X-Trans-Id', trans_id))
  AttributeError: 'dict_items' object has no attribute 'append'

Closes-Bug: #1929083
Change-Id: I5c398b6008716b64c668737e4201ba3b6ab3320b

URI.escape() method has been removed in ruby 3 and

commit_message:
Replace URI.escape() with ERB::Util.url_encode()

URI.escape() method has been removed in ruby 3 and
the newly added Puppet::Util.rfc2396_escape()[1]
has not been released yet.

[1] https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppet/pull/8588/commits/41dcae71c7d10b9cc3c190897d02c5082ddd2076

Closes-Bug: #1928685
Change-Id: I001d579a1b126fc8254f071ddbecda5cc6de7231
(cherry picked from commit 0699227b3cd02d8eec7f022f97a945313de46ed5)

to use parameter merge strategy and removes the *Defaults
interfaces.

commit_message:
Fix validations listing when filtering by group(s)

When running `openstack tripleo validator list --group pre-update`
command, it returns all the validations catalog and the filtering by
group(s) doesn't work.

This patch fixes this behavior by actually filtering.

Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I5152ad37c7e47a46eb23c3c792b31b2bf3298368

Store the 'name_upper' of the networks in the
network name id map, and use this name when
setting the port name in port definitions.

The port name is checked agains existing ports,
and since THT uses the upper case network name
when setting the port name the same (name_upper)
must be used here.

Closes-Bug: #1928711
Related: blueprint network-data-v2-ports
Change-Id: Iac7f351ce9ee965c17b6bc2956d140efe25ffcf4
"}]
commit_message:
Fix network-v2 node port idempotency

Store the 'name_upper' of the networks in the
network name id map, and use this name when
setting the port name in port definitions.

The port name is checked agains existing ports,
and since THT uses the upper case network name
when setting the port name the same (name_upper)
must be used here.

Closes-Bug: #1928711
Related: blueprint network-data-v2-ports
Change-Id: Iac7f351ce9ee965c17b6bc2956d140efe25ffcf4

commit_message:
Unblocking the openstack-tox-docs job.

Fixing indentation error breaking openstack-tox-docs

Adjusts openstack-tox-docs job to be triggered by
the validations_common directory changes.

Introducing upper-requirements constraint to the
doc build dependencies.

Adjusts ansible_autodoc to handle missing molecule confs.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I8021f786476b61bbf88bf21a1151ce3198f7abbd

commit_message:
Make Python Interpreter option for Ansible Validation Run

This patch adds the --python-interpreter argument to the run
subcommand and allows the user to specify their own python interpreter.

Change-Id: Ie76d0238f117a48b2f919cd5bdc4dfae8b47ac5e
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Licences are now listed for all requirements.

All required packages now have licence listed
next to their respective designations.

Licence information was pulled from pip show command
or from package repository, in cases where pip didn't
offer sufficient information.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I296be2577c85a33c91e2156ec1b36762526d599c

commit_message:
[train-only] Remove leapp data file download

This is an old mechanism which does not work with the new leapp.
We have implemented the data file download in workarounds, so
this interferes with that.

Change-Id: I075d122c9123b7a4b1737d4a7e8eca8a6fe4ecb2

Change-Id: I49944d585825b32052278cd865a74c46dcb5eaa4

commit_message:
Move the snapshots feature to optional/beta

Previously a commit[1] introduced a new way of doing backup, using
"snapshots", that do not require to bring down the whole controller to
take the backup. On that commit, the old way was removed, which do not
follow the deprecation procedure.

This commits reintroduces the old way of performing backups via stopping
the controllers and move the snapshots feature to an optional,
user-selected feature.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/786380

(cherry picked from commit 00a17ffb4a2262bffe750330bee333a8d3948247)
Change-Id: I49944d585825b32052278cd865a74c46dcb5eaa4

commit_message:
Drop Bionic support

Since victoria cycle, we have moved upstream testing to
Ubuntu Focal (20.04) and so does no Bionic distro in
Xena cycle testing runtime[1]. Grenade jobs also started
running on Focal since victoria was released.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-May/022248.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/octavia-tempest-plugin/+/788954

Change-Id: I42e82cdf9dd2fccc3e69689d14a686667431a9a9

commit_message:
Fix redis config location for centos > 8

The location of redis configuration has been moved to
/etc/redis/redis.conf in CentOS9 [1]. This patch is fixing redis_config
parameter to cover this new case.

[1] https://gitlab.com/redhat/centos-stream/rpms/redis/-/blob/c9s/redis.spec#L332

Change-Id: I92beff3ecc45fba5c12e49351dc8d9f7576777f1

commit_message:
Add support for ceph_iscsi cinder driver

This patch adds support to configure the new ceph iscsi driver

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/662829/
Depends-On:https://review.opendev.org/668667
Change-Id: Ica180e00dedb8e7ed60e27e3f4841faa8fef938c

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-04 17:14:14.000000000', 'message': 'BnR Test NFS server conectivity & ubi-minimal container image

When ReaR is configure there is no validation on the NFS server,
this patch adds a simple ping test validation to the NFS server.

This patch also switches from centos-8 to ubi-minimal container.

Change-Id: Ibbf7ba3435da8dc9218403df76f0eb86df4374db
'}, {'created': '2021-05-10 16:43:18.000000000', 'message': 'BnR Test NFS server conectivity & ubi-minimal container image

When ReaR is configure there is no validation on the NFS server,
this patch adds a simple ping test validation to the NFS server.
The NFS ping test can be disabled with a variable.

This patch also switches from centos-8 to ubi-minimal container.

Change-Id: Ibbf7ba3435da8dc9218403df76f0eb86df4374db
'}]
commit_message:
BnR Test NFS server conectivity & ubi-minimal container image

When ReaR is configure there is no validation on the NFS server,
this patch adds a simple ping test validation to the NFS server.
The NFS ping test can be disabled with a variable.

This patch also switches from centos-8 to ubi-minimal container.

Change-Id: Ibbf7ba3435da8dc9218403df76f0eb86df4374db

commit_message:
Enable mypy on libvirt/guest.py

This patch fixes couple of thing that is needed to run mypy

* fixed a wrong type hint in LibvirtDriver._add_vtpm_device,
  _configure_guest_by_virt_type, and _conf_non_lxc signature
* fixed a local variable type hint in LibvirtDriver._create_guest_with_network
* added an assert to _create_guest_with_network as the guest local
  variable can be None if we get eventlet.timeout.Timeout and
  CONF.vif_plugging_is_fatal is False.

Change-Id: I42c579531bac61063a381598094720271364ec92
(cherry picked from commit c17f1e14cfc78340f32102e5c861cf61a087a2a5)

subject: [stable-only] Preinstall pbr for devstack-tools
messages:
[{'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2021-05-13 14:05:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2021-05-13 14:07:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Be careful doing this. If the distro pbr package is built with distutils and not setuptools then pip won't be able to clean it up later. (Whether or not that is an issue I don't know)

Another option is to simply preinstall pbr with pip. Pip doesn't have the SNI issues that old easy_install has."}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2021-05-13 14:27:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2021-05-19 18:57:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2021-05-19 20:58:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

[{'created': '2021-05-13 14:05:59.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Preinstall pbr from distro repository

Change-Id: I0edd4734df8ac7976d3090b75ca4c033b8ff0f2c
'}, {'created': '2021-05-13 14:27:53.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Preinstall pbr from distro repository

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/791248
Change-Id: I0edd4734df8ac7976d3090b75ca4c033b8ff0f2c
'}, {'created': '2021-05-19 18:57:32.000000000', 'message': '[stable-only] Preinstall pbr for devstack-tools

Due to "Deprecation of non-SNI compatible clients" [1], when
devstack-tools is installed in early phase (in neutron-grenade job for
example) and pbr is not yet installed, the pip command fails with the
following error in xenial based environments:

File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/setuptools/command/easy_install.py", line 657, in easy_install
  raise DistutilsError(msg)
distutils.errors.DistutilsError: Could not find suitable distribution for Requirement.parse('pbr>=1.8')

This is because setuptools' easy_install is used, which is non-SNI
compatible in xenial base image (and python 3.5). With this patch the
issue can be avoided by preinstalling pbr just before the installation
of devstack-tools.

[1] https://github.com/pypa/pypi-support/issues/978

Change-Id: I0edd4734df8ac7976d3090b75ca4c033b8ff0f2c
'}]
commit_message:
[stable-only] Preinstall pbr for devstack-tools

Due to "Deprecation of non-SNI compatible clients" [1], when
devstack-tools is installed in early phase (in neutron-grenade job for
example) and pbr is not yet installed, the pip command fails with the
following error in xenial based environments:

File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/setuptools/command/easy_install.py", line 657, in easy_install
  raise DistutilsError(msg)
distutils.errors.DistutilsError: Could not find suitable distribution for Requirement.parse('pbr>=1.8')

This is because setuptools' easy_install is used, which is non-SNI
compatible in xenial base image (and python 3.5). With this patch the
issue can be avoided by preinstalling pbr just before the installation
of devstack-tools.

[1] https://github.com/pypa/pypi-support/issues/978

Change-Id: I0edd4734df8ac7976d3090b75ca4c033b8ff0f2c

commit_message:
Remove Block Storage API v2 support

The Block Storage API v2 was deprecated in Pike by change
I913c44799cddc37c3342729ec0ef34068db5b2d4 and is (finally)
being removed in Xena [0].  So remove v2 support from devstack.

[0] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/CinderXenaPTGSummary#Removing_the_Block_Storage_API_v2

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/792048
Change-Id: I856d78648d28ac4cad0fb212bef1ae6ad32fca90

subject: Add default policy files
messages:
[{'account_id': 12932, 'date': '2021-05-06 18:21:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12932, 'date': '2021-05-06 18:50:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 12932, 'date': '2021-05-06 18:59:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2021-05-12 01:45:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Could you please don't use launchpad for bug reporting? Use https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/project/openstack/trove-dashboard instead.

Also can you make come change in devstack script (https://github.com/openstack/trove-dashboard/blob/master/devstack/plugin.sh) to generate the policies and put the files in the right places?"}, {'account_id': 12932, 'date': '2021-05-12 22:08:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 12932, 'date': '2021-05-12 22:11:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2021-05-18 23:42:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2021-05-18 23:48:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2021-05-19 00:04:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

I'm wondering if this is necessary to put those generated files in the repo, which could be part of deployment process by following https://docs.openstack.org/horizon/latest/contributor/topics/policy.html#policy-file-maintenance?

Because this just brings some upstream maintenance overhead that we should manually run the command for each release. What do you think?"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2021-05-19 00:27:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1
> 
> I'm wondering if this is necessary to put those generated files in the repo, which could be part of deployment process by following https://docs.openstack.org/horizon/latest/contributor/topics/policy.html#policy-file-maintenance?
> 
> Because this just brings some upstream maintenance overhead that we should manually run the command for each release. What do you think?

The similar discussion happens in a designate-dashboard review https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/designate-dashboard/+/790140

yes, that is a possible option, but at the moment I did not choose this option when I wrote the original horizon patch from the following reasons:
- This approach is a workaround. We need to discuss a way which allows horizon to retieve the default policies from back-end services dynamically. It would be a future discussion point in the policy pop-up team.
- We already copied policy.json from each back-end serivces manually (or run oslopolicy-sample-generator), so changing the command is not a new overhead as upstream. (Note that I don't know trove-dashboard syncs policy.json before.)
- It is better to avoid a new requirements to deployment tools for a workaround. This might be a transient workaround and not a final decision. It is better to limit the impact inside horizon and plugins."}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2021-05-19 11:30:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> Patch Set 6:
> 
> > Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1
> > 
> > I'm wondering if this is necessary to put those generated files in the repo, which could be part of deployment process by following https://docs.openstack.org/horizon/latest/contributor/topics/policy.html#policy-file-maintenance?
> > 
> > Because this just brings some upstream maintenance overhead that we should manually run the command for each release. What do you think?
> 
> The similar discussion happens in a designate-dashboard review https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/designate-dashboard/+/790140
> 
> yes, that is a possible option, but at the moment I did not choose this option when I wrote the original horizon patch from the following reasons:
> - This approach is a workaround. We need to discuss a way which allows horizon to retieve the default policies from back-end services dynamically. It would be a future discussion point in the policy pop-up team.
> - We already copied policy.json from each back-end serivces manually (or run oslopolicy-sample-generator), so changing the command is not a new overhead as upstream. (Note that I don't know trove-dashboard syncs policy.json before.)
> - It is better to avoid a new requirements to deployment tools for a workaround. This might be a transient workaround and not a final decision. It is better to limit the impact inside horizon and plugins.

Well, personally I'm against the idea that put a static file in the repo which could become stale easily and should be generated dynamically. I'd rather prefer the way that we add some doc for trove-dashboard and leave it to deployers to decide how to sync the policy files, e.g. for us, before upgrading horizon, we prepare some files (i.e. the trove policy file) and put into the files folder in our ansible playbook."}, {'account_id': 12932, 'date': '2021-05-20 00:10:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Needing this file doesn't strike me as a unique dashboard problem. Any change in any project API is likely a breaking change for the associated dashboard -- one of the reasons we have release cycles is to provide an opportunity for separate OpenStack projects to sync up and ensure compatibility.

Generating this file requires a build environment that is different from any real-world deployed system. Producing such a build system strikes me as well out of scope for what we expect from our deployers.

I'm fully in favor of a CI-based solution for syncing this file, but unless that solution is coming in this release cycle let's follow existing cross-project standards so that our deployers don't loose their minds (or, more likely, decide that Trove is 'immature' and look elsewhere.)"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2021-05-20 08:55:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> Patch Set 6:
> 
> > Patch Set 6:
> > 
> > > Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1
> > > 
> > > I'm wondering if this is necessary to put those generated files in the repo, which could be part of deployment process by following https://docs.openstack.org/horizon/latest/contributor/topics/policy.html#policy-file-maintenance?
> > > 
> > > Because this just brings some upstream maintenance overhead that we should manually run the command for each release. What do you think?
> > 
> > The similar discussion happens in a designate-dashboard review https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/designate-dashboard/+/790140
> > 
> > yes, that is a possible option, but at the moment I did not choose this option when I wrote the original horizon patch from the following reasons:
> > - This approach is a workaround. We need to discuss a way which allows horizon to retieve the default policies from back-end services dynamically. It would be a future discussion point in the policy pop-up team.
> > - We already copied policy.json from each back-end serivces manually (or run oslopolicy-sample-generator), so changing the command is not a new overhead as upstream. (Note that I don't know trove-dashboard syncs policy.json before.)
> > - It is better to avoid a new requirements to deployment tools for a workaround. This might be a transient workaround and not a final decision. It is better to limit the impact inside horizon and plugins.
> 
> Well, personally I'm against the idea that put a static file in the repo which could become stale easily and should be generated dynamically. I'd rather prefer the way that we add some doc for trove-dashboard and leave it to deployers to decide how to sync the policy files, e.g. for us, before upgrading horizon, we prepare some files (i.e. the trove policy file) and put into the files folder in our ansible playbook.

If you defer the policy file sync to deployers, you will force deployers to prepare a build environment different from their real deployments. In most deployments, dashboard and trove are not installed together, but the build system to sync the policy file requreis both trove and dashboard/plugin. This is not a good situation from the point of view of deployers.

I understand that synced static files are not best but I don't think we should require more environments to deployers.

If you would like to solve this problem as community-wide, it would be really great. We are exploring a way to support the default policy incluidng deprecated policy rules considering develop bandwidth and using synced static files is one of compropomes. If you block the chnage only in trove-dashboard, what can deployers do? They need another work only for trove-dashboard. If you really think this approach should be rejected as OpenStack-wide, please discuss it in OpenStack-wide and lead the discussion."}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2021-05-20 11:35:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

> If you defer the policy file sync to deployers, you will force deployers to prepare a build environment different from their real deployments. In most deployments, dashboard and trove are not installed together, but the build system to sync the policy file requreis both trove and dashboard/plugin. This is not a good situation from the point of view of deployers.

At least for us (openstack based public cloud), generating the policy file in a docker container as part of CI doesn't sound like a complex process. Even if we put those static files in the repo, that process still exists in the CI pipeline because we need to make sure the files are up to date every time when we upppet/ansible horizon in the cloud.

I don't have the answers for the other deployers, but if I was them and I knew the static files are not guaranteed to be up to date, I would figure out a way to create those files by myself.

> I understand that synced static files are not best but I don't think we should require more environments to deployers.

Again, I don't think there are "more environments" to be managed. It's just a step in CI or an ansible task.

> If you would like to solve this problem as community-wide, it would be really great. We are exploring a way to support the default policy incluidng deprecated policy rules considering develop bandwidth and using synced static files is one of compropomes. If you block the chnage only in trove-dashboard, what can deployers do? They need another work only for trove-dashboard. If you really think this approach should be rejected as OpenStack-wide, please discuss it in OpenStack-wide and lead the discussion.

As I suggested, an installation guide for trove-dashboard should be useful for deployers. Maybe I missed the openstack-wide discussion that decided we should go for this way (maintaining static files in the repo), if there was any, I'd appreciate if you could give me some links. Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 12932, 'date': '2021-05-20 12:30:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

> Again, I don't think there are "more environments" to be managed. It's just a step in CI or an ansible task.

Building this file requires an environment with both the dashboard and the API project installed concurrently. That's not something that's likely to ever be present on a deployed system. I can tell you that even as a combination developer/deployer it was not obvious to me how to produce the file and took me quite a while to get a setup where the generation command would run properly.

Please do not offload this task onto deployers, especially as step unique to the Trove project.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2021-05-20 19:56:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

I think the discussion can be broken down into several parts.

The first one is about the approach itself (which uses the policy files generated based on back-end service policy-in-code).
The second is whether we should have this kind of autogenerated files in the repo or not.
The third is whether it is okay that only trove-dashboard requires different steps.

Regading the first point, the current approach is not ideal, but the current one is an approach which can be done only in horizon (and plugins) and it does not need changes in back-end services, so it was implemented as the first step to make deprecated policy rules work in dashboard policy evaluation. (The original horizon implementation was done in https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/horizon/+/750134.) There are several ideas to improve it (and avoid mirred static files) but it may take time as they might need changes in back-end services and perhaps it will take longer time.

Regarding the second point, it was not discussed explicitly in this context. horizon and several dashboard plugins keep policy.json (copied or generated from back-end services) in their repositories for long, so there was no explicit discussions to introduce a similar kind of files.

Generally speaking, it is not a good idea to put autogenerated files. I agree this in general. On the other hand, to generate the default policy file, you need to install a corresponding back-end service and horizon into a same python env and it may require a different env, and we would like to avoid adding a new task to deployers/packagers. If every deployer/packager does the same, it may be a good idea to provide it by the upstream.

A question on how to keep these files up-to-date was also raised in another review too. CI integration to automate this can be done by the horizon team.

Regarding the third point, I think it is better to use the same way across horizon and all plugins. If some plugin requires a different way, it would be confusing to users (deployers and packagers).

I believe some level of consistency is important across horizon and horizon plugins. I don't think it is good that only trove-dashboard goes its own way. If you believe we should not do this at all in horizon and plugins, please discuss it in openstack-discuss mailing list. Different deployers/packagers may have different opinions."}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2021-05-20 21:06:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

> Patch Set 6:
> 
> > Again, I don't think there are "more environments" to be managed. It's just a step in CI or an ansible task.
> 
> Building this file requires an environment with both the dashboard and the API project installed concurrently. That's not something that's likely to ever be present on a deployed system. I can tell you that even as a combination developer/deployer it was not obvious to me how to produce the file and took me quite a while to get a setup where the generation command would run properly.

So that's the reason I was proposing we add the the process description in the installation guide rather than put static files in the repo.

> 
> Please do not offload this task onto deployers, especially as step unique to the Trove project.

I believe the step is the same for all other openstack services, I see horizon has already put the files for nova/cinder/neutron/... in its repo, is there already a mechanism set up to keep those files up to date? How horizon maintainers are notified when there are some policies changed in other services?'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2021-05-20 21:32:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

> Generally speaking, it is not a good idea to put autogenerated files. I agree this in general. On the other hand, to generate the default policy file, you need to install a corresponding back-end service and horizon into a same python env and it may require a different env, and we would like to avoid adding a new task to deployers/packagers. If every deployer/packager does the same, it may be a good idea to provide it by the upstream.
> 
> A question on how to keep these files up-to-date was also raised in another review too. CI integration to automate this can be done by the horizon team.

This is the thing I care about. We shouldn't just add something mutable in the repo and go, say it's the repo maintainer's responsibility to keep those files up to date. I'm happy to see horizon team could do this, so all other dashboard plugins can follow.

> Regarding the third point, I think it is better to use the same way across horizon and all plugins. If some plugin requires a different way, it would be confusing to users (deployers and packagers).
> I believe some level of consistency is important across horizon and horizon plugins. I don't think it is good that only trove-dashboard goes its own way. If you believe we should not do this at all in horizon and plugins, please discuss it in openstack-discuss mailing list. Different deployers/packagers may have different opinions.

I totally agree that consistency is important across horizon and its plugins, so is "up-to-date". I don't believe trove-dashboard is the only plugin (out of horizon repo) that challenges this (seems like people were asking the similiar questions here https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/designate-dashboard/+/790140), I don't know what decision they will make in the end, but as PTL of trove-dashboard who maintains this repo, I'd like to see a more consitant and efficient approach that could handle the policy files easily.'}]

commit_message:
Add default policy files

These are consumed by Horizon and were generated
according to these instructions:

https://docs.openstack.org/horizon/latest/contributor/topics/policy.html#policy-file-maintenance

These files need to be copied into Horizon's conf directory
(e.g. /etc/openstack_dashboard) at install time.

Story: 2008897
Task: 42463
Change-Id: I65916ed3eac9c3c8ecabf1f276d5cdec571d115d

commit_message:
Remove train jobs from the project's CI queues

As stable/train just was switched to EM phase, we don't need to run
it's tests in the neutron-tempest-plugin CI.
Neutron-tempest-plugin is pinned to the 1.5.0 version in the train
jobs and that will be used in e.g. Neutron stable/train since now.

Change-Id: I2b7522e8d7fa9a973b00e59fcf5a0b5116bc5b6c

commit_message:
Collect the old and new path for outputs/passwords first

Now that Idded7faba1ff6c811b94503c559029aeeaca6a06 has merged, passwords
for tripleo deploy are written to the consistent working directory, so
both the old and new locations need to be collected in our job logs.

We collect the new path first with first_found, since it will be the
default path going forward.

Partial-Bug: #1921975
Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Iec4c477bf294514bbf9375fc77f44f5b37334bdb

hmm, the DnsServers parameter is set by getting the property from the networks attributes here[1], and for the ansible version of nic-config templates it should end up in the ctlplane_dns_nameservers here[2] var. The CONF.undercloud_nameservers is set up as the dns_nameservers for the CtlplaneNetworkAttributes here[3] which is what we put into the output of the Networks resource net_attributes_map output here[4].

commit_message:
Revert "Don't pass the DNSServers param in undercloud env"

This reverts commit f1450b3ae8036cfebdc1852ad11769e5585185d7.

Reason for revert: undercloud_nameservers is supposed to configured
/etc/resolv.conf. The previous patch broke the link between the
configuration and the os-net-config configuration to ensure that
/etc/resolv.conf was updated at install time.

Closes-Bug: #1929117
Change-Id: Ibec901441952ee3336ca3a6b7b4381c97d326d22

commit_message:
Make test_results folder visible in zuul

This patch moves test result logs [1] to tox folder [2]
so that it is automatically added to the list of log files by zuul

[1] sova.log, test_results/*
[2] .tox/<envname>/log

Change-Id: I57e4b05e199ded91b5ab26fa4054d6bbf1192fd2

commit_message:
New test cases for "zone transfer accept" suite.

1) "test_create_transfer_accept_using_invalid_key"
   Try to accept zone transfer using invalid key.
   Expected: 403 Forbidden

2) "test_create_transfer_accept_using_deleted_transfer_request_id"
   Try to use deleted transfer request ID, to accept zone ownership
   transfer. Expected: 404 NotFound

3) "test_show_transfer_accept_impersonate_another_project"
    Use Admin tenant + "x-auth-sudo-project-id" HTTP header,
    to impersonate another project to "show" its zone
    transfer accept.

Change-Id: Ib3df68a172b938b038932e4b2c85574fe1b0dcaa

commit_message:
Don't pass the DNSServers param in undercloud env

Change I4c102d8f728a90cf9eb90f6129738377a8d2503c
replaced use of the global DNSServers param, it now
uses the per-subnet DnsNameServers instead.

This is a cleanup to remove the now unused parameter.

Closes-Bug: #1834306
Depends-On: I4c102d8f728a90cf9eb90f6129738377a8d2503c
Change-Id: I6e2e728d9e749867be0a90a4e54dce7b5318994c

commit_message:
Use Block Storage API v3

The openstackclient has defaulted to using the v3 API since 4.0.0 [0],
so there is no reason for grenade to insist on using v2, especially since
v2 is being removed in Xena [1].

[0] https://opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient/commit/a96089ff6d54237a9e058dc1c7e6fc7e25695ecb
[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/792299

Change-Id: Ie558d45374f92f79942b80a9c27fd393ad4f4761

subject: WIP add unbound resolver port to share host with bind
messages: [{'account_id': 6681, 'date': '2021-04-09 17:35:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6681, 'date': '2021-05-20 18:07:26.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nthis has been replaced with another patch'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-09 17:35:16.000000000', 'message': 'WIP add unbound resolver port to share host with bind

In designate deployments, the unbound resolver and bind might live on
the same host. This patch creates an extra port on the network being
used as the public API network so unbound can be configured to bind to
it.

Change-Id: I28a1a9f32d010bcdcc8e809530247b8c484c2226
'}]
commit_message:
WIP add unbound resolver port to share host with bind

In designate deployments, the unbound resolver and bind might live on
the same host. This patch creates an extra port on the network being
used as the public API network so unbound can be configured to bind to
it.

Change-Id: I28a1a9f32d010bcdcc8e809530247b8c484c2226

commit_message:
Expose vhost_custom_fragment

It is provided by the Puppet class 'openstacklib::wsgi::apache'.
This change exposes it for the Cinder service.

commit_message:
Add a test case that ensures a quota usage is returned

This test checks that the correct quota usage is returned to a tenant
when an admin deletes a volume belonging to the tenant.

Change-Id: Id13d39576fb87020dc0a5a47949ed6d8364fef9b
Fixes: bug #1078729

commit_message:
Fix validations listing when filtering by group(s)

When running `openstack tripleo validator list --group pre-update`
command, it returns all the validations catalog and the filtering by
group(s) doesn't work.

This patch fixes this behavior by actually filtering.

Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I5152ad37c7e47a46eb23c3c792b31b2bf3298368

commit_message:
Implement basic protection testing jobs

This commit lays down a basic structure for protection tests. These are
useful for testing various secure RBAC personas, but leveraging all the
dynamic credential work in tempest's authentication libraries to
provision clients for testing. We're also adding a non-voting protection
test job so that we can integrate protection testing into the cinder
gate as we work through policy changes.

This commit also adds some basic tests exercising the capabilities
admin-only API. These tests ensure that only operators (e.g.,
system-administrators) or formally known as project-administrators, can
access the capabilities API. Assertions and functionality in these tests
may expand in the future to accomodate system-scope when cinder can
properly consume system-scoped tokens from keystone.

For now, the tests assume project-administrators are deployment
operators, which is the legacy way of denoting "admin-ness" in OpenStack
deployments.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/778753

Change-Id: I6d4ae6d516f4c2dda4dcb6b974857b34f2ef2254

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-12 14:42:06.000000000', 'message': 'Tests: test_backup - specify volume_type_id for snapshots

Without this, __DEFAULT__ is passed into the volume_type_id
field on the snapshot object, resulting in Invalid UUID
warnings being printed while running unit tests.

Change-Id: I028d9401a458eb5442682da0e8293e05aa80a4b5
'}]
commit_message:
Tests: test_backup - specify volume_type_id for snapshots

Without this, __DEFAULT__ is passed into the volume_type_id
field on the snapshot object, resulting in Invalid UUID
warnings being printed while running unit tests.

Change-Id: I028d9401a458eb5442682da0e8293e05aa80a4b5

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-29 12:12:33.000000000', 'message': 'Replace blind retry with libvirt event waiting in detach

Nova so far applied a retry loop that tried to periodically detach the
device from libvirt while the device was visible in the domain xml. This
could lead to an issue where an already progressing detach on the
libvirt side is interrupted by nova re-sending the detach request for
the same device. See bug #1882521 for more information.

Also if there was both a persistent and a live domain the nova tried the
detach from both at the same call. This lead to confusion about the
result when such call failed. Was the detach failed partially?

We can do better, at least for the live detach case. Based on the
libvirt developers detaching from the persistent domain always
succeeds and it is a synchronous process. Detaching from the live
domain can be both synchronous or asynchronous depending on the guest
OS and the load on the hypervisor. But for live detach libvirt always
sends an event [1] nova can wait for.

So this patch does two things.

1) Separates the detach from the persistent domain from the detach from
   the live domain to make the error cases clearer.

2) Changes the retry mechanism.

   Detaching from the persistent domain is not retried. If libvirt
   reports device not found, while both persistent and live detach
   is needed, the error is ignored, and the process continues with
   the live detach. In any other case the error considered as fatal.

   Detaching from the live domain is changed to always wait for the
   libvirt event. In case of timeout, the live detach is retried.
   But a failure event from libvirt considered fatal, based on the
   information from the libvirt developers, so in this case the
   detach is not retried.

Conflicts:
      nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py
      nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_guest.py
      nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py
      nova/virt/libvirt/guest.py

These conflicts are due to two other bugfixes backported earlier from
master to wallaby than the current fix.

* f99f667a96a357adc0070d75b5940e76726f9664 causing only whitespace
  damage
* I0e068043d8267ab91535413d950a3e154c2234f7 is a fix that was valid both
  before and after the current patch but need changes in different
  places due to the current fix also impacting the same detach path

Related-Bug: #1882521

[1]https://libvirt.org/html/libvirt-libvirt-domain.html#virConnectDomainEventDeviceRemovedCallback

Change-Id: I7f2b6330decb92e2838aa7cee47fb228f00f47da
(cherry picked from commit e27f51fdb7873fc39cf93f49838661eed11b1e03)

Related-Bug: #1882521

[1]https://libvirt.org/html/libvirt-libvirt-domain.html#virConnectDomainEventDeviceRemovedCallback

commit_message:
Replace blind retry with libvirt event waiting in detach

Nova so far applied a retry loop that tried to periodically detach the
device from libvirt while the device was visible in the domain xml. This
could lead to an issue where an already progressing detach on the
libvirt side is interrupted by nova re-sending the detach request for
the same device. See bug #1882521 for more information.

Also if there was both a persistent and a live domain the nova tried the
detach from both at the same call. This lead to confusion about the
result when such call failed. Was the detach failed partially?

We can do better, at least for the live detach case. Based on the
libvirt developers detaching from the persistent domain always
succeeds and it is a synchronous process. Detaching from the live
domain can be both synchronous or asynchronous depending on the guest
OS and the load on the hypervisor. But for live detach libvirt always
sends an event [1] nova can wait for.

So this patch does two things.

1) Separates the detach from the persistent domain from the detach from
   the live domain to make the error cases clearer.

2) Changes the retry mechanism.

   Detaching from the persistent domain is not retried. If libvirt
   reports device not found, while both persistent and live detach
   is needed, the error is ignored, and the process continues with
   the live detach. In any other case the error considered as fatal.

   Detaching from the live domain is changed to always wait for the
   libvirt event. In case of timeout, the live detach is retried.
   But a failure event from libvirt considered fatal, based on the
   information from the libvirt developers, so in this case the
   detach is not retried.

Related-Bug: #1882521

[1]https://libvirt.org/html/libvirt-libvirt-domain.html#virConnectDomainEventDeviceRemovedCallback

Change-Id: I7f2b6330decb92e2838aa7cee47fb228f00f47da
(cherry picked from commit e56cc4f439846558fc13298c2360d7cdd473cc89)

commit_message:
Replace URI.escape() with ERB::Util.url_encode()

URI.escape() method has been removed in ruby 3 and
the newly added Puppet::Util.rfc2396_escape()[1]
has not been released yet.

[1] https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppet/pull/8588/commits/41dcae71c7d10b9cc3c190897d02c5082ddd2076

Closes-Bug: #1928685
Change-Id: I001d579a1b126fc8254f071ddbecda5cc6de7231

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-19 18:31:31.000000000', 'message': 'Introduce CephHciOsdCount and CephHciOsdType

CephHciOsdCount is the number of expected Ceph OSDs per HCI node.
CephHciOsdType is the type of data_device (not db_device) used for
each OSD and must be one of hdd, ssd, or nvme. These are used by
the Ansible module tripleo_derive_hci_parameters. Since CephOsdSpec,
as used by cephadm, might only specify a description of devices to
be used as OSDs (e.g. all devices), and not a list of devices like
CephAnsibleDisksConfig, setting the count directly is necessary in
order to know how much CPU/RAM to reserve. Similarly, because a
device path is not hard coded, we cannot look up that device in
Ironic to determine its type.

Closes-Bug: #1920954
Depends-On: Ia6bbdf023e2a0961cd91d3e9f40a8a5a26253ba3
Change-Id: Iccf97ca676ee6096e47474c571bd4f53381ce1c9

commit_message:
Introduce CephHciOsdCount and CephHciOsdType

CephHciOsdCount is the number of expected Ceph OSDs per HCI node.
CephHciOsdType is the type of data_device (not db_device) used for
each OSD and must be one of hdd, ssd, or nvme. These are used by
the Ansible module tripleo_derive_hci_parameters. Since CephOsdSpec,
as used by cephadm, might only specify a description of devices to
be used as OSDs (e.g. all devices), and not a list of devices like
CephAnsibleDisksConfig, setting the count directly is necessary in
order to know how much CPU/RAM to reserve. Similarly, because a
device path is not hard coded, we cannot look up that device in
Ironic to determine its type.

Closes-Bug: #1920954
Depends-On: Ia6bbdf023e2a0961cd91d3e9f40a8a5a26253ba3
Change-Id: Iccf97ca676ee6096e47474c571bd4f53381ce1c9
(cherry picked from commit f14bfb14c7cb8b0af2d1663160ff43e1e38bb882)

commit_message:
ubuntu-bionic for openstack-python37-jobs-no-constraints

The other python-version-specific job templates specify nodeset
overrides if the jobs they include don't (for example those directly
including jobs from the zuul-jobs standard library). Fix this in
tox-py37-no-constraints so that it works again after this week's
OpenDev default nodeset change.

Change-Id: I069e76814130c10c6f691626b319ebb9f0fbf472

INFO:kolla.common.utils.monasca-grafana:go install -v ./pkg/cmd/grafana-server
INFO:kolla.common.utils.monasca-grafana:[91mgo: cannot find main module, but found vendor/vendor.json in /grafana/src/github.com/grafana/grafana

INFO:kolla.common.utils.monasca-grafana:        go mod init

Let's unblock the gate and diagnose asynchronously.

Change-Id: Id113a53c083d105ac9200474ff20faacef6decaf
"}]
commit_message:
CI: add monasca-grafana to allowed-to-fail images

The monasca-grafana image is currently failing to build.

INFO:kolla.common.utils.monasca-grafana:go install -v ./pkg/cmd/grafana-server
INFO:kolla.common.utils.monasca-grafana:[91mgo: cannot find main module, but found vendor/vendor.json in /grafana/src/github.com/grafana/grafana
INFO:kolla.common.utils.monasca-grafana:        to create a module there, run:
INFO:kolla.common.utils.monasca-grafana:        go mod init

Let's unblock the gate and diagnose asynchronously.

Change-Id: Id113a53c083d105ac9200474ff20faacef6decaf

commit_message:
Add mitogen to the docs requirements

Mitogen is dependency of the pyroute2 and was added link to it
the docs in pyroute2 0.6.1. Due to the missing mitogen in our
docs venv, docs job was failing.
So let's install mitogen as docs env requirement, at least for now
to unblock our gate.
Later we can think about better solution as e.g. adding it properly to
the requirements or report and fix the issue in the pyroute2.

Change-Id: Iba37581916842bb5fc9f42f7f483d3431747bf8d
Closes-Bug: #1928913

commit_message:
Remove old release jobs and update to latest

With the latest change[0] officially dropping support for older
non-maintained releases, this change removes several EOL release
jobs as well as bumps anything using those up to the latest
supported T release.

[0] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-helm/+/788380

Change-Id: I8df32c6bcc0b9a0c65aa1299c6a792b27da81ae8

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-28 12:44:15.000000000', 'message': '[OVN] Fix: Disabling snat after it was enabled

This patch removes a conditional check in the update_router() method
which was verifying if snat was enabled in order to update the nat
rules. This check does not make sense in the update method as if snat
was disabled we should still call update_nat_rules() which will then
remove the NAT entry from the OVN NB DB.

Change-Id: Ice20d22365acaf33ee211b1e38b7d0bc151c1ba8
Closes-Bug: #1922089
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
[OVN] Fix: Disabling snat after it was enabled

This patch removes a conditional check in the update_router() method
which was verifying if snat was enabled in order to update the nat
rules. This check does not make sense in the update method as if snat
was disabled we should still call update_nat_rules() which will then
remove the NAT entry from the OVN NB DB.

Change-Id: Ice20d22365acaf33ee211b1e38b7d0bc151c1ba8
Closes-Bug: #1922089
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add OVNEncapType option to the ovn controller template

Since OVN 2.13 it is possible to use vxlan encapsulation in the OVN
tunnel networks.
To do that, it has to be set in the external_ids:ovn-encap-type. There
is support for that in the puppet-ovn module already.
This patch adds missing TripleO-heat-template variable.

Related-bz: #1881697
Change-Id: I54e617745e76f27a4c88156a9b1b17d0255ec837
(cherry picked from commit 1542df355bd22b83baaba1444fc58028046a5185)

commit_message:
tripleo_repos: add tripleo_repos_repo_branch

Allow an user to pull tripleo-repos from master but install TripleO
Train repos.
They'll be able to do that with overriding tripleo_repos_repo_branch to
"master" while tripleo_repos_branch would be set to "train".

Note: if tripleo_repos_repo_branch is undefined, we default to
tripleo_repos_branch.

Change-Id: Ic4aafd9ed1b005354cd55a59868dd8edf7504837

commit_message:
Fix RBD timeout

On the RBD driver the rados_connect_timeout is not working and the
default 300 seconds timeout is being applied.

Refer to a patch of cinder:
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/368189

Signed-off-by: Armstrong Liu <vpbvmw651078@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I676c00217da3c62b9aeb0dc819042904f39b5e23

commit_message:
Rocky and before: Use ubuntu-bionic by default

The default nodeset has been switched from Bonic to Focal, which
resulted in failures in CI jobs.

Change-Id: I11919bf7dbcc0821ae3d12949da702ab581cc3e5

[{'created': '2021-05-13 11:58:31.000000000', 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I4f5ebb221bb305ec82aaa94829c2b16f72fa7a3c
"}]
commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I4f5ebb221bb305ec82aaa94829c2b16f72fa7a3c

tests: Split external service fixtures out

There's no need to throw these into one giant file.

Change-Id: I8478449d15edb40f98d25d3940343cae9ab2fde8
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Use the new type HostDomainOpt.

Use the new oslo.confg type HostDomainOpt to support underscore in the
name. You can see the bugzilla[1] to have more information.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1868940

Related-Bug: #1892044
Change-Id: Ib6c8fc1e3d90b79b10066c429670fcb957bddd23

[stable/wallaby] Drop -master jobs

As listed in release steps, we should drop these jobs from stable
branches as they only make sense in master

Change-Id: I73e396ab134cb547ff99220ead062c51a32a42ef

commit_message:
[OVN] Disabling SNAT doesn't take effect if the router has already snat enabled

Fix logic in OVN router update where SNAT is changing.

Closes-bug: #1928988
Change-Id: I5e3037ccbdf7e86b1ea7cb868f88ce0179611afb

commit_message:
Note env OS_PLACEMENT_API_VERSION support

The placement client (osc-placement) supports the
``OS_PLACEMENT_API_VERSION`` environment variable,
but it is not described in the ``openstack -h`` command.

So this patch adds the description as well as other
environment variables.

Change-Id: I41a3718bfa27ecf370c7375b4f761cda47866b1a

rules and can jsut use upstream ones.

We also update ansible and collections version to
match with the integrated repo.

[1] https://github.com/ansible-community/ansible-lint/commit/8bef056d698f4cda64a52eec73fc9b6f70e40cb3

Change-Id: Ie85d6d0a17849bbc665a7f49644c38b5f6a96bb2
"}]
commit_message:
Bump ansible-lint and ansible version

ansible-lint 5.0.9 has merged our NoLogPasswordRule [1]
APTRepositoryCacheUpdateRule is not relevant since
ansible fix has been merged for several years now.
Also ansible-lint provides yamllint check.

This means, we shouldn't really carry custom lint
rules and can jsut use upstream ones.

We also update ansible and collections version to
match with the integrated repo.

[1] https://github.com/ansible-community/ansible-lint/commit/8bef056d698f4cda64a52eec73fc9b6f70e40cb3

Change-Id: Ie85d6d0a17849bbc665a7f49644c38b5f6a96bb2

commit_message:
Fix gitreview host name

This can cause issues with release automation when the repo is tagged
since the host will not match what is expected for the ssh key.

Change-Id: Ice57bdeb6bae18412056d5b60ea05ae557d6f0f2
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-24 19:57:17.000000000', 'message': 'Disable vrrp healthchecks by default

VRRP healthchecks were enabled by default starting in the 19.07 charm
release for network deployments which utilize l3ha or dvr+snat. The VRRP
healthchecks have specific expectations that may not be satisfied in
various data centers. This leads to problems with networks as failed
healthchecks lead to router failovers.

This change alters the default config option to disable the vrrp
healthchecks by default and require users to opt in to using them. The
description around the option has been updated to indicate that doing so
may lead to routers failing over if ICMP pings are missed.

Change-Id: Ie281a311a95ba394d72c2dfeeb0a1a0a12847e77
Closes-Bug: #192101
'}]
commit_message:
Disable vrrp healthchecks by default

VRRP healthchecks were enabled by default starting in the 19.07 charm
release for network deployments which utilize l3ha or dvr+snat. The VRRP
healthchecks have specific expectations that may not be satisfied in
various data centers. This leads to problems with networks as failed
healthchecks lead to router failovers.

This change alters the default config option to disable the vrrp
healthchecks by default and require users to opt in to using them. The
description around the option has been updated to indicate that doing so
may lead to routers failing over if ICMP pings are missed.

Change-Id: Ie281a311a95ba394d72c2dfeeb0a1a0a12847e77
Closes-Bug: #192101

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-19 19:00:05.000000000', 'message': "Add mitogen to the docs requirements

Mitogen is dependency of the pyroute2 and was added link to it
the docs in pyroute2 0.6.1. Due to the missing mitogen in our
docs venv, docs job was failing.
So let's install mitogen as docs env requirement, at least for now
to unblock our gate.
Later we can think about better solution as e.g. adding it properly to
the requirements or report and fix the issue in the pyroute2.

Closes-Bug: #1928913
Change-Id: Ib91b3e2fb0da0ed730654948bdb682df138a9261
(cherry picked from neutron commit b881c5a032cccbe0f78444af6571907ad4bc98c5)
"}]
commit_message:
Add mitogen to the docs requirements

Mitogen is dependency of the pyroute2 and was added link to it
the docs in pyroute2 0.6.1. Due to the missing mitogen in our
docs venv, docs job was failing.
So let's install mitogen as docs env requirement, at least for now
to unblock our gate.
Later we can think about better solution as e.g. adding it properly to
the requirements or report and fix the issue in the pyroute2.

Closes-Bug: #1928913
Change-Id: Ib91b3e2fb0da0ed730654948bdb682df138a9261
(cherry picked from neutron commit b881c5a032cccbe0f78444af6571907ad4bc98c5)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-05 17:08:12.000000000', 'message': "Use absolute values for shard shrinking config options

Add two new sharder config options for configuring shrinking
behaviour:

  - shrink_threshold: the size below which a shard may shrink
  - expansion_limit: the maximum size to which an acceptor shard
    may grow

The new options match the 'swift-manage-shard-ranges' command line
options and take absolute values.

The new options provide alternatives to the current equivalent options
'shard_shrink_point' and 'shard_shrink_merge_point', which are
expressed as percentages of 'shard_container_threshold'.
'shard_shrink_point' and 'shard_shrink_merge_point' are deprecated but
will take precedence over the new options if they are explicitly set
in a config file.

The default values of the new options are the same as the values that
would result from the default 'shard_container_threshold',
'shard_shrink_point' and 'shard_shrink_merge_point' i.e.:

  - shrink_threshold: 100000
  - expansion_limit: 500000

Change-Id: Icd3364eabd4ceea96de06d2272c07fa5537f0a75
"}, {'created': '2021-03-08 11:54:16.000000000', 'message': "Add absolute values for shard shrinking config options

  - expansion_limit: 750000

Change-Id: Icd3364eabd4ceea96de06d2272c07fa5537f0a75
"}, {'created': '2021-05-19 14:26:51.000000000', 'message': "Add absolute values for shard shrinking config options

Add two new sharder config options for configuring shrinking
behaviour:

  - shrink_threshold: the size below which a shard may shrink
  - expansion_limit: the maximum size to which an acceptor shard
    may grow

The new options match the 'swift-manage-shard-ranges' command line
options and take absolute values.

The new options provide alternatives to the current equivalent options
'shard_shrink_point' and 'shard_shrink_merge_point', which are
expressed as percentages of 'shard_container_threshold'.
'shard_shrink_point' and 'shard_shrink_merge_point' are deprecated and
will be overridden by the new options if the new options are
explicitly set in a config file.

The default values of the new options are the same as the values that
would result from the default 'shard_container_threshold',
'shard_shrink_point' and 'shard_shrink_merge_point' i.e.:

  - shrink_threshold: 100000
  - expansion_limit: 750000

Change-Id: Icd3364eabd4ceea96de06d2272c07fa5537f0a75
"}]
commit_message:
Add absolute values for shard shrinking config options

Add two new sharder config options for configuring shrinking
behaviour:

  - shrink_threshold: the size below which a shard may shrink
  - expansion_limit: the maximum size to which an acceptor shard
    may grow

The new options match the 'swift-manage-shard-ranges' command line
options and take absolute values.

The new options provide alternatives to the current equivalent options
'shard_shrink_point' and 'shard_shrink_merge_point', which are
expressed as percentages of 'shard_container_threshold'.
'shard_shrink_point' and 'shard_shrink_merge_point' are deprecated and
will be overridden by the new options if the new options are
explicitly set in a config file.

The default values of the new options are the same as the values that
would result from the default 'shard_container_threshold',
'shard_shrink_point' and 'shard_shrink_merge_point' i.e.:

  - shrink_threshold: 100000
  - expansion_limit: 750000

Change-Id: Icd3364eabd4ceea96de06d2272c07fa5537f0a75

commit_message:
Fix unit tests: "python: command not found"

It seems like "python" is no longer a valid command in ubuntu-focal, we
should use python3.

Change-Id: I68db03009eba87cd89c0ff0479fb106cdb322dcf
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
